intro: Eupatorium oxylepis var. densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks. Its showy, clustered inflorescences attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
